description: Halo Nevus, also known as Sutton's Nevus, is a type of mole characterized by a white ring or halo around it. It is a benign skin condition that typically appears in childhood or adolescence.
possible causes: Unknown exact cause, possibly related to immune response
symptoms: Presence of a mole with a white ring around it
treatments: No treatment necessary as it is usually harmless
Monitoring for any changes in size or shape
